item.title: PWKv2/OSCP - Certification Review
item.description: OSCP After years of certifications, CTFs, and job changes, I finally took and finished the PWKv2 course this year and got my OSCP certification. Of all the certifications I’ve worked for, this was unsurprisingly the most time-consuming and difficult to attain. I started my course right after PWKv2 was released, so I got to be one of the first to see the new material and lab environments. Throughout the process of learning the material and attacking lab machines, I learned a ton and would recommend it to anyone looking to really boost their confidence and expertise.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Hello! Having finally gotten this site up and running, I thought it would be time to do an introductory post about who I am and what I’ll be publishing here. Information security is a lifestyle for me as well as a profession. Outside of work, I’m usually doing CTFs, researching new methodologies and attack types, and working on a certification or course of some kind. I want this to be a place where I share things I’ve learned in different forms.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a penetration tester and security researcher. I do CTF challenges in my free time. Profiles Twitter Github HackTheBox Certifications OSCP GWAPT CEHv9 CISA Recent Training Offensive Security - Pentesting With Kali v2 SANS SEC642 - Advanced Web App Penetration Testing SANS SEC442 - Web App Penetration Testing EC-Council - Malware & Memory Forensics EC-Council - Mobile Forensics
